page.title: 08GREAT CANFIELD FORGE
page.content: Records show there was a shed for shoeing horses on the site in 1644; also that a smith's shop was pulled down at the beginning of this century. The present business probably started about that time - mainly for the repair of agricultural machinery. The current proprietor is Norman Furneaux. He took over the business in l980 from Ernest Clarke with whom he had collaborated on various assignments over the previous 20 years. These included decorative {wrought iron work}for churches and cathedrals, notably screens for the Lady Chapel at Bury St. Edmunds Cathedral and railings and roses for the Elizabeth and Mary monument in Westminster Abbey.
